unnormalised: **Question:** What are some yoga practices that have genuinely improved your well-being?
normalised: **Question:** What are some yoga practices that have genuinely improved your well-being?

unnormalised: Like many others, my journey with yoga started tentatively, mostly because my doctor in Delhi kept nagging me to do *something* about my stress levels. Turns out, he was right!
normalised: Like many others, my journey with yoga started tentatively, mostly because my doctor in Delhi kept nagging me to do something about my stress levels. Turns out, he was right!

unnormalised: I began with a basic Hatha class at a local studio inspired by the teachings of the Bihar School of Yoga. The initial focus was simply on mastering the asanas – Surya Namaskar, Trikonasana, and particularly, Shavasana, which was bliss after a hectic day dealing with clients.
normalised: I began with a basic Hatha class at a local studio inspired by the teachings of the Bihar School of Yoga. The initial focus was simply on mastering the asanas – Surya Namaskar, Trikonasana, and particularly, Shavasana, which was bliss after a hectic day dealing with clients.

unnormalised: But the real breakthrough came when I incorporated pranayama. Anulom Vilom (alternate nostril breathing) has become my go-to for instant anxiety relief. I also found that practicing Brahmari (humming bee breath) before bed helps me sleep like a baby. Remember Geet from "Jab We Met" – "Sardarni hoon main, apni toh baat hi alag hai"? Well, my sleep used to be as restless as hers!

unnormalised: Beyond the physical and mental benefits, yoga has instilled a sense of discipline and mindfulness. It’s not just about stretching; it’s about connecting with yourself, your breath, and finding a moment of peace amidst the chaos of everyday life.
normalised: Beyond the physical and mental benefits, yoga has instilled a sense of discipline and mindfulness. It’s not just about stretching; it’s about connecting with yourself, your breath, and finding a moment of peace amidst the chaos of everyday life.

unnormalised: I haven't reached enlightenment yet, mind you! But I definitely feel calmer, more grounded, and a lot less like pulling my hair out every time I check my overflowing inbox. Worth a shot, right?
